SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

ncbi.blast
Class NCBIBlastClient

java.lang.Object
  ncbi.blast.NCBIBlastClient

public class NCBIBlastClient
extends java.lang.Object

The blast client for SolPicker which uses the NCBI blastcl3 program To use this client you must have an internet connection. Important Note: If running this client with SolPicker, netblast must be downloaded and put into the same directory where SolPicker executable is.

Version:
$Id: NCBIBlastClient.html,v 1.3 2009/10/16 23:08:53 tizatt Exp $
Author:
tizatt
See Also:
blastcl3

Fasta formatted file.

private java.lang.String outputFile
File where output will be directed to when using netblast().

program

private final java.lang.String program
The blast program to be used by the Blast Client. For available options consult setProgram(String). Default is program.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

database

private final java.lang.String database
Database to be used by netblast(). Default is "nr". For available options see setDatabase(String)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

descriptionsUpperLimit

private final int descriptionsUpperLimit
The maximum number of descriptions to show for the blast client output. Default is 2 - because BlastFilter.filter(java.util.ArrayList) filters for uniqueness, therefore it only checks if there is greater than one match. For more information see setDescriptionsUpperLimit(int).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

alignmentsUpperLimit

private final int alignmentsUpperLimit
The maximum number of alignments to show for the blast client output. Default is 2 The maximum number of descriptions to show for the blast client output. Default is 2 - because BlastFilter.filter(java.util.ArrayList) filters for uniqueness and alignment length, therefore it only checks if there is greater than one match and if there is only one what its align length is. For more information see setAlignmentsUpperLimit(int).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

                       java.lang.String outputFile)
Constructor for NCBIBlastClient

Method Detail

setProgram

public void setProgram(java.lang.String program)
Specifies which program to run. Default is none, MANDATORY. Options: blastn, blastp, blastx, tblastn, tblastx.

Parameters:
program -

setDatabase

public void setDatabase(java.lang.String database)
Specifies target database to search against. Default is nr, MANDATORY. To search against multiple databases separate database names by a space Example: -d "db1 db2".

Parameters:
database -

setInputQueryFile

public void setInputQueryFile(java.lang.String file)
Specifies input query file. Include complete filename with extension. Default is stdin.

Parameters:
file - - a file containing query sequences. Typical format is multi-fasta.

setExpectValueCutOff

public void setExpectValueCutOff(int value)
Specifies expect value cutoff. Accepted formats are integer, fraction, decimal, exponential, and scientific notation. To set the cutoff to 2*10-20, use -e 2e-20

Parameters:
value - -

setAlignmentViewOption

public void setAlignmentViewOption(int alignmentView)
Options: 0 Pairwise 1 query-anchored showing identities 2 query-anchored no identities 3 flat query-anchored, show identities 4 flat query-anchored, no identities 5 query-anchored no identities and blunt ends 6 flat query-anchored, no identities and blunt ends 7 XML Blast output 8 tabular (not post processing) 9 tabular with comment lines (post-processed, sorted) 10 ASN, text 11 ASN, binary

Parameters:
alignmentView - - the output format of the alignment

setOutputFile

public void setOutputFile(java.lang.String outputFile)
Specifies the output file. Default is stdout.

Parameters:
outputFile - - file where blast output is stored

setFilter

public void setFilter(java.lang.String filter)
Specifies which filter(s) to use to mask query sequence. Default is T (DUST for nucleotide, SEG for protein). Options: T,F,D,L,R,V,S,C, and m.

Parameters:
filter - - a filter optoin (T,F,D,L,R,V,S,C, or m).

setGapOpenPenalty

public void setGapOpenPenalty(int gapOpen)
Cost to open a gap. Default 0. Default invokes 5 for blastn

Parameters:
gapOpen - - integer representing the cost to open a gap.

setGapExtendPenalty

public void setGapExtendPenalty(int gapExtend)
Cost to extend a gap. Default 0. Default invokes 2 for blastn.

Parameters:
gapExtend - - integer representing the cost to extend a gap.

setGappedAlignmentDropoff

public void setGappedAlignmentDropoff(int gappedAlignDropoff)
X dropoff value for gapped alignment (in bits). Default is 0. Default settings: blastn - 30 megablast - 20 tblastx - 0 others - 15

Parameters:
gappedAlignDropoff -

setShowGIInDefline

public void setShowGIInDefline(boolean gi)
Show GI in definition line

Parameters:
gi - - if true, definition line will be shown

setNucleotideMismatchPenalty

public void setNucleotideMismatchPenalty(int mismatchPenalty)
Specifies penalty for a nucleotide mismatch. Default is -3. For blastn only. Different -r/-q rtios are optimal for aligning sequences with different percentage of similarities.

Parameters:
mismatchPenalty -

setNucleotideMatchReward

public void setNucleotideMatchReward(int reward)
Specifies reward for a nucleotide match. Default is 1. For blastn only. Others use external scoring matrix to determine this.

Parameters:
reward -
See Also:
setProteinScoringMatrix(String)

setDescriptionsUpperLimit

public void setDescriptionsUpperLimit(int limit)
Specifies the upper limit of database sequences to show descriptions for. Actual number may be lower due to lack of hits above -e cutoff. Default is 500.

Parameters:
limit - - upper limit of database sequences to show description for.

setAlignmentsUpperLimit

public void setAlignmentsUpperLimit(int limit)
Specifies the upper limit of database sequences to show alignment for. Physical limit is 200000. Web counterpart: "Alignments". This is NOT the total number of alignment segments or high scoring pairs(HSPs). Rather it is the number of database sequences with HSP(s) to the query. Default is 250.

Parameters:
limit -

setThresholdForExtendingHits

public void setThresholdForExtendingHits(int threshold)
Specifies the threshold for extending hits. Default is 0. Default Setting: blastp - 11 blastn - 0 blastx - 12 tblastn - 13 tblastx - 13 megablast - 0

Parameters:
threshold -

setPerformGappedAlignment

public void setPerformGappedAlignment(boolean performGappedAlignment)
Specifies whether or not to perform a gapped alignment. Default is gapped alignment (true), not available with tblastx.

Parameters:
performGappedAlignment -

setQueryGeneticCode

public void setQueryGeneticCode(int geneticCode)
Specifies query genetic code to use. Default is 1. This specifies the translation table used in query translation during blastx and tblastx searches. The default is universal codon.

Parameters:
geneticCode -
See Also:
translation table

setDBGeneticCode

public void setDBGeneticCode(int geneticCode)
Specifies database genetic code to use. Default is 1. This specifies the translation table used in query translation during blastx and tblastx searches. The default is universal codon.

Parameters:
geneticCode -
See Also:
translation table

setNumOfProcessors

public void setNumOfProcessors(int numOfProcessors)
Specifies the number of processors to use. This method may not be relevant after the splitd implementation. Default is 1.

Parameters:
numOfProcessors -

setSeqAlignOutputFile

public void setSeqAlignOutputFile(java.lang.String file)
Specifies file to save SeqAlign Object to. Default N/A.

Parameters:
file -
See Also:
ftp://ftp.ncbi.nih.gov/blast/demo/

setBelieveQueryDefline

public void setBelieveQueryDefline(boolean queryDefline)
Specifies whether to believe the query definition line or not. Default is false. Since most query deflines do not follow NCBI convention the default is false.

Parameters:
queryDefline -

setProteinScoringMatrix

public void setProteinScoringMatrix(java.lang.String matrix)
Specifies the protein scoring matrix to use. Default: BLOSUM62. Options: BLOSUM45, BLOSUM62, BLOSUM80, PAM30, OR PAM70.

Parameters:
matrix -

setWordSize

public void setWordSize(int wordSize)
Specifies the word size for different programs. Default is 0. Default Settings: blastn - 11 megablast - 28 all others - 3

Parameters:
wordSize -

setDatabaseLength

public void setDatabaseLength(double databaseLength)
Specifies the effective length of the database. Default is 0. Default setting: Leaving out this parameter or setting it to zero (0), BLAST will use the actual database size.

Parameters:
databaseLength -

setNumOfBestHitsToKeepFromRegion

public void setNumOfBestHitsToKeepFromRegion(int numOfHits)
Specifies the number of best hits from a region to keep. Default is 0. This selects the specified number of best hits for a given region of the query for further evaluation. Off by default, 100 is recommended if used.

Parameters:
numOfHits -

setUseMultipleHit

public void setUseMultipleHit(int useMultipleHit)
Specifies whether to use multiple hit or not. Default is 0. Zero is for multiple hit, 1 for single hit. Not applicable to blastn.

Parameters:
useMultipleHit -

setLengthOfSearchSpace

public void setLengthOfSearchSpace(double length)
Specifies the effective length of the search space. Default is 0. This is the product of effective query length and effective database length - actual length corrected for edge effects. Use zero for actual size.

Parameters:
length -

setStrandsOfQuery

public void setStrandsOfQuery(int queryStrands)
Specifies strands of the nucleotide query to use in the search. Default is 3. Options: 1 - Input sequence, 2 - Reverse complement, 3 - Both (meanings for blastn, blastx, and tblastx).

Parameters:
queryStrands -

setProduceHTMLOutput

public void setProduceHTMLOutput(boolean produceHTMLOutput)
Specifies whether or not to produce HTML output. Default is false. With true, BLAST will hyperlink the matched subject sequences to their actual entries in Entrez.

Parameters:
produceHTMLOutput -

setRestrictDatabaseSearchToSubset

public void setRestrictDatabaseSearchToSubset(java.lang.String entrezTerms)
Restrict search of database to the subset satisfying the query. Default is N/A. Argument to this parameter is a set of valid Entrez query terms. BLAST server will use the terms to retrieve a list of GI numbers and use them to restrict the BLAST search to entries specified by the list. Make sure valid terms are used. For example, it does not make sense to restrict a search to genomic sequences while searching against the est database.

Parameters:
entrezTerms -
See Also:
Entrez Help

setLowercaseFilter

public void setLowercaseFilter(boolean lowerCaseFilter)
Specifies whether or not to use lower case filtering of FASTA sequence. Default is false. Make sure that only the query sequences to be masked are in UPPERCASE and only the filtered portions are in lowercase.

Parameters:
lowerCaseFilter -

setDropoffValueForUngappedExtensions

public void setDropoffValueForUngappedExtensions(double dropoffValue)
Specifies the X dropoff value for ungapped extensions (in bits). Default is 0. Default settings for ungapped extension X dropoff (in bits): blastn - 20, megablast - 10, others - 7.

Parameters:
dropoffValue -

setDropoffValueForFinalGappedAlignment

public void setDropoffValueForFinalGappedAlignment(int dropoffValue)
Specifies the X dropoff value for final gapped alignment (in bits). Default is 0. Large dropoff value settings may help generate longer alignment. Default setting for ungapped alignment X dropoff (in bits): blastn - 50, megablast - 50, tblastx - 25, all others - 0.

Parameters:
dropoffValue -

setRunRpsblastSearch

public void setRunRpsblastSearch(boolean runRpsblastSearch)
Specifies whether or not to run the rpsblastSearch. Default is false. Setting this to "T" will perform rpsblast search against CDD database. It requires an appropriate database input. Refer to setDatabase(String)

Parameters:
runRpsblastSearch -
See Also:
setDatabase(String)

setEnableMegablast

public void setEnableMegablast(boolean enableMegablast)
Specifies whether or not to enable megablast. Default is false. Setting this to true invokes megablast algorithm. setWordSize(int) will default to 28 and queries will be concatenated. This will help speed up the search at the expense of search sensitivities.

Parameters:
enableMegablast -

setLocationOnQuerySeq

public void setLocationOnQuerySeq(java.lang.String locationOnQuerySeq)
Specifies the location to use on a query sequence. Example - "100,400", 100 is the start and 400 the end.

Parameters:
locationOnQuerySeq -

setMultipleHitsWindowSize

public void setMultipleHitsWindowSize(int windowSize)
Specifies the window size for multiple hits. Default is 0. Default Settings for different programs: blastn - 0, megablast - 0, all others - 40

Parameters:
windowSize -

setFrameShiftPenalty

public void setFrameShiftPenalty(int frameShiftPenalty)
Specifies the frame shift penalty. Default is 0 (no penalty). Non-zero setting invokes OOF (Out of Frame) algorithm for blastx.

Parameters:
frameShiftPenalty -

setLengthOfLargestIntron

public void setLengthOfLargestIntron(int length)
Specifies the length of the largest intron allowed in tblastn for linking HSPs. Default is 0. Zero disables linking. Otherwise the value specified will be used.

Parameters:
length -

getClientOptions

public java.lang.String getClientOptions()
Retrieves the clientOptions for this BlastClient. The options are formatted for the blastcl3 program.

Returns:
clientOptions
See Also:
formatClientOptions()

formatClientOptions

public void formatClientOptions()
Formats the clientOptions for this BlastClient according to blastcl3

See Also:
getClientOptions()

netblast

protected void netblast()
Executes the blast client program using the default parameters found in setDefaultOptions(). For this method to work the latest version of netblast must be downloaded. Save the folder (netblast-2.2.21) to the same directory as the executable for SolPicker.

See Also:
setDefaultOptions(), NETBLAST, JobFactory.netBlastDir

setDefaultOptions

public void setDefaultOptions()
Sets the default options for this class ../.. . Default settings are as follows: database - "nr", program - "blastn", descriptionsUpperLimit - 2, alignmentsUpperLimit - 2

See Also:
setInputQueryFile(String), setDatabase(String), setProgram(String), setOutputFile(String), setDescriptionsUpperLimit(int), setAlignmentsUpperLimit(int), database, program, descriptionsUpperLimit, alignmentsUpperLimit
